author: Special Correspondent
text:
Collector K. S. Palanisamy has advised pawn brokers to inform the Returning Officer, Assistant Returning Officer or other election official about any sudden and suspicious redeeming of jewels by the borrowers.

Tokens

Addressing pawn brokers at a meeting convened here on Sunday, he said the district administration had received complaints about the distribution of tokens by supporters of some political parties to borrowers.

These tokens, according to the complaint, were being distributed by agents of various parties during or after the ‘aarthi’ being offered to nominee-aspirants or nominees.

“Based on the tokens, pawn brokers got the principal and interest from the political parties thereby releasing the pledged jewels,” the Collector said. K. Tharpagaraj, District Revenue Officer, was among those who were present.
title: “Inform suspicious redemption of jewels”
